text: Big Brain Academy is a puzzle video game. It was published by Nintendo and was developed by Nintendo EAD. It was released on June 30, 2005 in Japan, June 5, 2006 in North America, July 5, 2006 in Australia, and on July 7, 2006 in Europe. The player creates a profile and is given tests and quizzes by a Dr. Lobe, a blob made of brain matter. The tests he gives the player is designed to make the player think, analyze, memorize, compute, and identify. At the end of the tests, Dr. Lobe measures the brain weight of the player and gives them a letter grade. A sequel titled Big Brain Academy: Wii Degree was released on April 26, 2007. ==Reception== The game recieved mixed reviews by game critics. Critics said that they felt that it easy to learn and fun. However, some critics did not like there was not really much variety in the games and that it was too simple at times. ==References== Category:2005 video games Category:Brain training video games Category:Casual games Category:Multiplayer and single-player video games Category:Nintendo DS games Category:Nintendo Entertainment Analysis and Development games Category:Nintendo video games Category:Puzzle video games Category:Video games developed in Japan Category:Virtual Console games Category:Virtual Console games for Wii U
